The Left Centre for Budget and Policy Priorities estimated that Bush ' s post-tax income reductions increased from the highest 1 per cent from 5.3 per cent to 6.7 per cent from 2004 to 2012 (high-income tax rates were raised the following year). The Trump scheme would increase the income of the wealthy after tax by between 10.2 and 19.9 per cent, according to the tax institution, and reduce the tax by 1.32 per cent of GDP.
